summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Federal Bureau of Prisons Legal Counsel, regarding the provision of a secured laptop to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for the purpose of reviewing discovery materials in her criminal case. The letter details the security modifications made to the laptop.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center who is to receive a specially modified laptop for reviewing discovery in her criminal case, United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter authorizing the provision of the laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution of Maxwell and her office is providing discovery materials to the defendant.

events.title: Laptop Provision for Discovery Review
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office provides a secured laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center to allow her to review discovery materials for her criminal case.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center (Reg. No. 02879-509) as of November 2020.

The U.S. Attorney's Office provided a laptop to Maxwell specifically for reviewing discovery in her case (20 Cr. 330), with all recording and communication capabilities (microphone, camera, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Ethernet) disabled.
The letter confirms the ongoing legal proceedings in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell and the prosecution's logistical coordination with the Bureau of Prisons.
